833 {

846 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
847 // API for objects that are allowed to create inline-level objects
848 class InlineLevelCreatorApi
849 {
850 protected:
851  ImoContentObj* m_pParent;
852 
853  inline void set_inline_level_creator_api_parent(ImoContentObj* parent)
854  {
855  m_pParent = parent;
856  }
857 
858 public:
859  InlineLevelCreatorApi() : m_pParent(nullptr) {}
860  virtual ~InlineLevelCreatorApi() {}
861 
862  //API
863  ImoTextItem* add_text_item(const string& text, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
864  ButtonCtrl* add_button(LibraryScope& libScope, const string& label,
865  const USize& size, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
866  ImoInlineWrapper* add_inline_box(LUnits width=0.0f, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
867  ImoLink* add_link(const string& url, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
868  ImoImage* add_image(unsigned char* imgbuf, VSize bmpSize, EPixelFormat format,
869  USize imgSize, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
870  ImoControl* add_control(Control* pCtrol);
871 
872 };
873 
874 
875 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
876 // API for objects that are allowed to create block-level objects
877 class BlockLevelCreatorApi
878 {
879 protected:
880  ImoContentObj* m_pParent;
881 
882  inline void set_box_level_creator_api_parent(ImoContentObj* parent)
883  {
884  m_pParent = parent;
885  }
886 
887 public:
888  BlockLevelCreatorApi() : m_pParent(nullptr) {}
889  virtual ~BlockLevelCreatorApi() {}
890 
891  //API
892  ImoContent* add_content_wrapper(ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
893  ImoList* add_list(int type, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
894  ImoMultiColumn* add_multicolumn_wrapper(int numCols, ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
895  ImoParagraph* add_paragraph(ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
896  ImoScore* add_score(ImoStyle* pStyle=nullptr);
897 
898 private:
899  void add_to_model(ImoBlockLevelObj* pImo, ImoStyle* pStyle);
900 
901 };

903 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
904 // Auxiliary class: An attribute
905 
906 // AttribValue can hold one of <int, float, double, bool, string, Color>.
907 // In C++17 it could be declared as simple as:
908 // typedef std::variant<int, float, double, bool, string, Color> AttribValue;
909 // But we implement it manually to support older compilers.
910 class AttribValue
911 {
912 private:
913  union
914  {
915  int intValue;
916  string stringValue;
917  bool boolValue;
918  float floatValue;
919  double doubleValue;
920  Color colorValue;
921  };
922 
923  enum AttribType { vt_empty, vt_int, vt_string, vt_bool, vt_float, vt_double, vt_color };
924  AttribType m_type = vt_empty;
925 
926 public:
927  AttribValue() {}
928  ~AttribValue() { Cleanup(); }
929 
930  explicit operator int() const
931  {
932  CheckType(vt_int);
933  return intValue;
934  }
935  explicit operator float() const
936  {
937  CheckType(vt_float);
938  return floatValue;
939  }
940  explicit operator double() const
941  {
942  CheckType(vt_double);
943  return doubleValue;
944  }
945  explicit operator bool() const
946  {
947  CheckType(vt_bool);
948  return boolValue;
949  }
950  explicit operator string() const
951  {
952  CheckType(vt_string);
953  return stringValue;
954  }
955  explicit operator Color() const
956  {
957  CheckType(vt_color);
958  return colorValue;
959  }
960 
961  void operator=(int value)
962  {
963  Cleanup();
964  intValue = value;
965  m_type = vt_int;
966  }
967  void operator=(float value)
968  {
969  Cleanup();
970  floatValue = value;
971  m_type = vt_float;
972  }
973  void operator=(double value)
974  {
975  Cleanup();
976  doubleValue = value;
977  m_type = vt_double;
978  }
979  void operator=(bool value)
980  {
981  Cleanup();
982  boolValue = value;
983  m_type = vt_bool;
984  }
985  void operator=(const string& value)
986  {
987  Cleanup();
988  // placement new (http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/union)
989  new (&stringValue) string(value);
990  m_type = vt_string;
991  }
992  void operator=(const Color& value)
993  {
994  Cleanup();
995  // placement new (http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/union)
996  new (&colorValue) Color(value);
997  m_type = vt_color;
998  }
999 
1000 private:
1001  void Cleanup()
1002  {
1003  if (m_type == vt_string)
1004  {
1005  // explicit destructor call (http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/union)
1006  stringValue.~string();
1007  }
1008  else if (m_type == vt_color)
1009  {
1010  // explicit destructor call (http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/union)
1011  colorValue.~Color();
1012  }
1013  m_type = vt_empty;
1014  }
1015 
1016  void CheckType(AttribType type) const
1017  {
1018  if (type != m_type)
1019  {
1020  stringstream ss;
1021  ss << "[AttribValue::operator(<type>)]. Type mismatch. Expected type=" <<
1022  type << ", real type=" << m_type;
1023  LOMSE_LOG_ERROR(ss.str());
1024  throw std::runtime_error(ss.str());
1025  }
1026  }
1027 };

1119 //=======================================================================================
1120 // Auxiliary data containers. They are composite data types used to encapsulate data
1121 // for the IM, but they are not nodes in the IM tree.
1122 //
1123 // They are just passive data structures (= Plain old data (POD), = Pasive Data Structure
1124 // (PDS), = record), that is a collections of field values, without using object-oriented
1125 // features. The C++ compiler guarantees that there will be no "magic" going on in the
1126 // structure: for example hidden pointers to vtables, offsets that get applied to
1127 // the address when it is cast to other types (at least if the target's Type too),
1128 // constructors, or destructors. Roughly speaking, a type is a Type when the only things
1129 // in it are built-in types and combinations of them. The result is something that
1130 // "acts like" a C type.
1131 //
1132 // This 'Type' classes are auxiliary and they are not nodes in the IM tree.
1133 //=======================================================================================
1134 
1135 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1143 class TypeMeasureInfo
1144 {
1145 public:
1146  int index;
1147  int count;
1149  string number;
1151  bool fHideNumber;
1152 
1154 
1155  TypeMeasureInfo()
1156  : index(0)
1157  , count(0)
1158  , number("")
1159  , fHideNumber(false)
1160  {
1161  }
1162 
1163  ~TypeMeasureInfo() {}
1164 };

1211  //flag values
1212  enum
1213  {
1214  k_dirty = 0x0001, //dirty: modified since last "clear_dirty()" ==> need to rebuild GModel
1215  k_children_dirty = 0x0002, //this is not dirty but some children are dirty
1216  k_edit_terminal = 0x0004, //terminal node for edition
1217  k_editable = 0x0008, //in edition, this node can be edited
1218  k_deletable = 0x0010, //if editable, this node can be also deleted
1219  k_expandable = 0x0020, //if editable, more children can be added/inserted
1220  };

1490  inline bool is_tuplet_dto() { return m_objtype == k_imo_tuplet_dto; }
1491  inline bool is_volta_bracket() { return m_objtype == k_imo_volta_bracket; }
1492  inline bool is_volta_bracket_dto() { return m_objtype == k_imo_volta_bracket_dto; }
1493 
1494  //special checkers
1495  inline bool is_mouse_over_generator() { return m_objtype == k_imo_link
1496  || m_objtype == k_imo_button
1497  ; }
1498 
1499 protected:

1501  void propagate_dirty();
1502  void remove_id();
1503  void delete_attributes();
1504 
1505  //attributes

1508  ImoAttr* get_last_attribute();

2132  //getters non-inheriting from parent. Returns true if property exists
2133  bool get_float_property(int prop, float* value)
2134  {
2135  map<int, float>::const_iterator it = m_floatProps.find(prop);
2136  if (it != m_floatProps.end())
2137  {
2138  *value = it->second;
2139  return true;
2140  }
2141  else
2142  return false;
2143  }
2144 
2145  bool get_lunits_property(int prop, LUnits* value)

2148  if (it != m_lunitsProps.end())
2149  {
2150  *value = it->second;
2151  return true;
2152  }
2153  else
2154  return false;
2155  }
2156

2160  if (it != m_stringProps.end())
2161  {
2162  *value = it->second;
2163  return true;
2164  }
2165  else
2166  return false;
2167  }
2168 
2169  bool get_int_property(int prop, int* value)

2172  if (it != m_intProps.end())
2173  {
2174  *value = it->second;

2176  }
2177  else
2178  return false;
2179  }
2180 
2181  bool get_color_property(int prop, Color* value)
2182  {
2183  map<int, Color>::const_iterator it = m_colorProps.find(prop);
2184  if (it != m_colorProps.end())
2185  {
2186  *value = it->second;
2187  return true;
2188  }
2189  else
2190  return false;
2191  }
2192 
2193  //getters. If value not stored, inherites from parent
2194  float get_float_property(int prop)
2195  {
2196  map<int, float>::const_iterator it = m_floatProps.find(prop);
2197  if (it != m_floatProps.end())
2198  return it->second;
2199  else if (m_pParent)
2200  return m_pParent->get_float_property(prop);
2201  else
2202  {
2203  LOMSE_LOG_ERROR("Aborting. Style has no parent.");
2204  throw std::runtime_error( "[ImoStyle::get_float_property]. No parent" );
2205  }
2206  }
2207 
2208  LUnits get_lunits_property(int prop)
2209  {
2210  map<int, LUnits>::const_iterator it = m_lunitsProps.find(prop);
2211  if (it != m_lunitsProps.end())
2212  return it->second;
2213  else if (m_pParent)
2214  return m_pParent->get_lunits_property(prop);
2215  else
2216  {
2217  LOMSE_LOG_ERROR("Aborting. Style has no parent.");
2218  throw std::runtime_error( "[ImoStyle::get_lunits_property]. No parent" );
2219  }
2220  }
2221 
2222  const string& get_string_property(int prop)
2223  {
2224  map<int, string>::const_iterator it = m_stringProps.find(prop);
2225  if (it != m_stringProps.end())
2226  return it->second;
2227  else if (m_pParent)
2228  return m_pParent->get_string_property(prop);
2229  else
2230  {
2231  LOMSE_LOG_ERROR("Aborting. Style has no parent.");
2232  throw std::runtime_error( "[ImoStyle::get_string_property]. No parent" );
2233  }
2234  }
2235 
2236  int get_int_property(int prop)
2237  {
2238  map<int, int>::const_iterator it = m_intProps.find(prop);
2239  if (it != m_intProps.end())
2240  return it->second;
2241  else if (m_pParent)
2242  return m_pParent->get_int_property(prop);
2243  else
2244  {
2245  LOMSE_LOG_ERROR("Aborting. Style has no parent.");
2246  throw std::runtime_error( "[ImoStyle::get_int_property]. No parent" );
2247  }
2248  }
2249 
2250  Color get_color_property(int prop)
2251  {
2252  map<int, Color>::const_iterator it = m_colorProps.find(prop);
2253  if (it != m_colorProps.end())
2254  return it->second;
2255  else if (m_pParent)
2256  return m_pParent->get_color_property(prop);
2257  else
2258  throw std::runtime_error( "[ImoStyle::get_color_property]. No parent" );
2259  }

3331 //The <score-part> element allows for multiple score-instruments per
3332 //score-part. ImoMidiInfo contains the MIDI information for one score-instrument
3333 class ImoMidiInfo : public ImoSimpleObj
3334 {
3335 protected:
3336  string m_soundId; //id of the score-instrument
3337 
3338  //midi device
3339  int m_port; //port: 0-15 (MIDI 1-16)
3340  string m_midiDeviceName; //DeviceName meta event
3341 
3342  //midi instrument
3343  string m_midiName; //name: ProgramName meta-events
3344  int m_bank; //bank: 0-16383 (MIDI 1-16,384)
3345  int m_channel; //channel: 0-15 (MIDI 1-16)
3346  int m_program; //patch: 0-127 (MIDI 1-128)
3347  int m_unpitched; //pitch number for percussion: 1-128
3348 
3349  //mixer information
3350  float m_volume; //channel volume: 0.0 (muted) to 1.0
3351  int m_pan; //degrees: -180 to 180.
3352  // 0 = in front of the listener, centered
3353  //-90 = hard left, 90 is hard right
3354  //-180 and 180 = behind the listener, centered
3355  int m_elevation; //degrees: -90 to 90.
3356  // 0 = listener level
3357  // 90 = directly above
3358  //-90 = directly below.
3359

3368  , m_channel(-1)
3369  , m_program(0)
3370  , m_unpitched(0)
3371  , m_volume(1.0)
3372  , m_pan(0)
3373  , m_elevation(0)
3374  {
3375  }

4759 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4760 class ImoGoBackFwd : public ImoStaffObj
4761 {
4762 protected:
4763  bool m_fFwd;
4764  TimeUnits m_rTimeShift;
4765 
4766  const TimeUnits SHIFT_START_END; //any too big value
4767 
4768  friend class ImFactory;
4769  ImoGoBackFwd()
4770  : ImoStaffObj(k_imo_go_back_fwd), m_fFwd(true), m_rTimeShift(0.0)
4771  , SHIFT_START_END(100000000.0)
4772  {}
4773 
4774 public:
4775  virtual ~ImoGoBackFwd() {}
4776 
4777  //getters and setters
4778  inline bool is_forward()
4779  {
4780  return m_fFwd;
4781  }
4782  inline void set_forward(bool fFwd)
4783  {
4784  m_fFwd = fFwd;
4785  }
4786  inline bool is_to_start()
4787  {
4788  return !m_fFwd && (m_rTimeShift == -SHIFT_START_END);
4789  }
4790  inline bool is_to_end()
4791  {
4792  return m_fFwd && (m_rTimeShift == SHIFT_START_END);
4793  }
4794  inline TimeUnits get_time_shift()
4795  {
4796  return m_rTimeShift;
4797  }
4798  inline void set_to_start()
4799  {
4800  set_time_shift(SHIFT_START_END);
4801  }
4802  inline void set_to_end()
4803  {
4804  set_time_shift(SHIFT_START_END);
4805  }
4806  inline void set_time_shift(TimeUnits rTime)
4807  {
4808  m_rTimeShift = (m_fFwd ? rTime : -rTime);
4809  }
4810 };

7394  //If not empty, this text is used to be displayed in the volta bracket instead
7395  //the volta numbers, i.e.: "First time" instead of "1".

7397
